text: The Diocese of Hanuato'o is one of the nine current dioceses of the Anglican Church of Melanesia; it was erected in 1991 and inaugurated at St George's Church, Kirakira on St Peter's Day, 29 June 1991. That church is now her cathedral, rededicated as St Peter's Cathedral; the diocese is divided into fifteen parishes. ==List of bishops== {| class="wikitable" style="width: 95%;" |- ! colspan="4" style="background-color: #7F1734; color: white;" | Bishops of Hanuato'o |- ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 8%;" | From ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 8%;" | Until ! style="background- color: #D4B1BB; width: 33%;" | Incumbent ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 46%;" | Notes |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1991 | style="text-align: center;" | 2004 | James Mason | James Philip Mason, first bishop; consecrated and installed on 19 June 1991;List of small publications in the Archives of the Anglican Church of Melanesia (in the National Archives of Solomon Islands) p. 17.
